data.title: Tarnsman Gor by John Norman, First Edition
data.meta_description: Tarnsman Of Gor by Norman, John (Frederick John Lange) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Ballantine Books No.U6071, a Paperback Original with fabulous cover art; the first volume in "the strange history of counter-earth", i.e. the world of Gor, at once controversial and spellbinding, these books garnered an enormous following and were written by a doctor of philosophic logic and owes a great deal to Edgar Rice Burroughs; this copy is Near Fine with light reading crease and very light, overall wear; scarce as described.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. Ballantine Books No.U6071, a Paperback Original with fabulous cover art; the first volume in "the strange history of counter-earth", i.e. the world of Gor, at once controversial and spellbinding, these books garnered an enormous following and were written by a doctor of philosophic logic and owes a great deal to Edgar Rice Burroughs; this copy is Fine- with light rubbing on the rear cover, otherwise very bright and unmarked; scarce in described condition.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Book has mild edgewear, light rubbing to the wraps, a flat uncreased spine and a store stamp to the inside of the front cover, else clean. Ballantine U6071. First edition, first printing.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Fine first paperback edition of this book , the first in the Counter Earth of Gor series. This copy has a previous owner's name on the first page but is otherwise unmarked. There is some light age toning present. Wraps are in fine condition with bright colors and only very minimal wear. A nice collectible copy.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good -. D'Achille, Gino;Kelly, Ken W.; Hescox, Richard; Foster, Robert (illustrator). First and Later Printings. All volumes have creased spines with edge rubbings. Store stamped.Books include :1-Tarnsman of Gor,2- Outlaw of Gor,3- Priest-Kings of Gor,4- Nomads of Gor,5-Assassin of Gor,6- Raiders of Gor,7- Captive of Gor,8- Hunters of Gor,9- Marauders of Gor, 10-Tribesman oF Gor,11- Slave Girl of Gor,12- Beasts of Gor,13-Explorers of Gor,14-Fighting Slave of Gor,15- Rogue of Gor,16-Guardsman of Gor,17-Savages of Gor,18-Blood Brothers of Gor,19-Kajirs of Gor,20-Players of Gor, 21-Mercenaries of Gor,22-Dancers of Gor,23- Renegades of Gor,24- Vagabonds of Gor, 25-Magicians of Gor.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good +. D'Achille, Gino;Kelly, Ken W.; Hescox, Richard; Foster, Robert (illustrator). First and Later Printings. All volumes have uncreased spines with very light edge rubbings. Store stamp-5,9,14,16,17,19,20,21.Books include :1-Tarnsman of Gor,2- Outlaw of Gor,3- Priest-Kings of Gor,4- Nomads of Gor,5-Assassin of Gor,6- Raiders of Gor,7- Captive of Gor,8- Hunters of Gor,9- Marauders of Gor, 10-Tribesman oF Gor,11- Slave Girl of Gor,12- Beasts of Gor,13-Explorers of Gor,14-Fighting Slave of Gor,15- Rogue of Gor,16-Guardsman of Gor,17-Savages of Gor,18-Blood Brothers of Gor,19-Kajirs of Gor,20-Players of Gor, 21-Mercenaries of Gor,22-Dancers of Gor,23- Renegades of Gor,24- Vagabonds of Gor, 25-Magicians of Gor.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Some fading on the spine of the dust jacket. Very clean and price intact. Some minor bumping on the top and bottom of the spine. Clean, tight binding. Book has not lost any original colour.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. 1st Edition. Red cloth. Book is in great, very clean and sharp, looking nearly as new. Dust jacket has some light overall yellowing, one faint area of rubbing at top of spine. otherwise an excellent jacket, very sharp, now protected in an archival cover. Detailed photos on request.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. Format(Cover Designer) (illustrator). First Edition. Tarnsman of Gor by John Norman (First Edition) Firm square copy. Some rubbing to the jacket. Foxing to the front and back flap edges. Small tear to bottom back flap corner. First published in Great Britain in 1969, stated. First hardcover edition. Publisher's red cloth with gilt spine lettering. Original pictorial dust jacket. BOOK.
